material.mattext:
Quiz 9 - Control design for wheeled robots

This quiz covers Chapter 8 of the notes.

 Instructions

  • This quiz consists of 10 questions, covering content from the previous week.
  • You are allowed to submit the quiz an unlimited number of times with no time limit, and on each submission you can review each incorrect question attempt after the fact.
  • When reattempting the quiz, only the previously incorrect question(s) from the last attempted quiz will be available to attempt. The correct question(s) from the last attempted quiz will automatically be added to your score.

Position error in the world-frame is defined by

$$^W{\bf e}_p = {^W{\bf p}^*}+{^W{\bf p}},$$

where \( {^W{\bf p}^*}\) is the desired position, and \( {^W{\bf p}} \) is the current position.

Position error in the world-frame is defined by

$$^W{\bf e}_p = {^W{\bf p}^*}-{^W{\bf p}}.$$
Under what condition is the world-frame position error equivalent to the body-frame position error, namely \( {^W{\bf e}_p} = {^B{\bf e}_p} \)?

Determine the position error in the world-frame when the desired position is given by

$$ {^W{\bf p}^*}=\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \end{bmatrix}^T,$$

and the current position is described by

$$ {^W{\bf p}}=\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 & 4 \end{bmatrix}^T.$$

Given a desired position of

$$ {^W{\bf p}^*}=\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \end{bmatrix}^T,$$

and a current position of

$$ {^W{\bf p}}=\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 & 4 \end{bmatrix}^T,$$

determine the body-frame error vector when the rotation matrix is given by

$$ {^W{\bf R}}_B=\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & -0.6 & -0.8 \\ 0 & 0.8 & -0.6 \end{bmatrix},$$

Given a desired position of

$$ {^W{\bf p}^*}=\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 1 & 0 \end{bmatrix}^T,$$

and a current position of

$$ {^W{\bf p}}=\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 & 0 \end{bmatrix}^T,$$

determine \({^W{\bf R}}_B\) when the body-frame position error is given by

$$ {^B{\bf e}_p}=\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 & 0 \end{bmatrix}^T.$$

The rotation matrix describing the desired orientation with respect to the body frame is calculated using

$$ {^B{\bf R}}_D={^W{\bf R}}_D {^W{\bf R}}_B.$$

The rotation matrix describing the desired orientation with respect to the body frame is calculated using

$$ {^B{\bf R}}_D={^W{\bf R}}^T_B{^W{\bf R}}_D .$$

Determine the rotation matrix describing the desired orientation in the body frame when

$$ {^W{\bf R}}_B = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & -0.6 & -0.8 \\ 0 & 0.8 & -0.6 \end{bmatrix},$$

and 

$$ {^W{\bf R}}_D = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 1 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 1 \end{bmatrix},$$

Determine the rotation matrix describing the current orientation in the world frame when

$$ {^W{\bf R}}_D = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & -0.6 & -0.8 \\ 0 & 0.8 & -0.6 \end{bmatrix},$$

and 

$$ {^B{\bf R}}_D = \begin{bmatrix} -0.6 & 0 & 0.8 \\ 0 & 1 & 0 \\ -0.8 & 0 & -0.6 \end{bmatrix}.$$
The proportional translation controller using forward error is given by
Given wheel speed saturation, the workspace boundary of the body velocities is described by a
